election_record.label: New York 1821 State Senate, Western District

overview.note: The name of Anda Nobles, was listed as Anse Nobles in the Official State Wide Canvass.

sub_unit.name: Centerville
sub_unit.note: The Albany Argus (Albany, NY) and The American list 4 votes for James MacCall.

"In the town of Centerville in the county of Allegany, 44 votes were returned for James McCall in figures and not in words at length, and only 4 votes in words at length; which 4 were admitted and the figures rejected." The Albany Argus (Albany, NY). May 25, 1821.

sub_unit.name: Broome
sub_unit.note: James MacCall received 34 votes as James M Call.

sub_unit.name: Cattaraugus
sub_unit.note: James MacCall received 22 votes as James M. Call and 75 votes as James M Call.

sub_unit.name: Chautauque
sub_unit.note: The New York Censor May 8, 1821 lists totals in Chautaque county as Samuel M. Hopkins 678 votes, Henry Seymour 586 votes, Stephen Bates 674 votes and James MacCall 580 votes.

sub_unit.name: Clymer
sub_unit.note: James MacCall received 1 vote as John MacCal.

sub_unit.name: Cortland
sub_unit.note: Elijah Litchfield received 1 vote as Elisha Litchfield.

sub_unit.name: Erie
sub_unit.note: Samuel M. Hopkins received 1 vote as Samuel M. Opkins.

sub_unit.name: Genesee
sub_unit.note: Samuel M. Hopkins received 1 vote as Samuel H. Hopkins.
James MacCall received 154 votes as James M. Call.

sub_unit.name: Murray
sub_unit.note: James MacCall received 51 votes as James M Call.

sub_unit.name: Livingston
sub_unit.note: James MacCall received 1 vote as James M'All.

sub_unit.name: Cicero
sub_unit.note: The Albany Argus (Albany, NY) lists 58 votes for Henry Seymour and James MacCall.

sub_unit.name: Marcellus
sub_unit.note: The Albany Argus (Albany, NY) lists 163 votes for Henry Seymour.
The Albany Argus (Albany, NY) lists 160 votes for James MacCall.

sub_unit.name: Spafford
sub_unit.note: The Albany Argus (Albany, NY) lists 47 votes for James MacCall in the scattering votes.

sub_unit.name: Ontario
sub_unit.note: James MacCall received 150 votes as James M. Call and 21 votes as James M Call.

sub_unit.name: Hannibal
sub_unit.note: James MacCall received 34 votes as James M. Call.

election_record.reference: Original Election Books. Steuben County Court House, Bath.
The American. (For the Country) (New York, NY). May 2, 1821.
Spirit of the Times (Batavia, NY). May 4, 1821.
The New-York Columbian (New York, NY). May 7, 1821.
Spirit of the Times (Batavia, NY). May 11, 1821.
The American. (For the Country) (New York, NY). June 9, 1821.
Original Manuscript of New York Assembly Elections. Michael J. Dubin.
